page.title: 16LIFE STYLES 2
page.content: The Landlady of the{Rising Sun}feels that the villagers get a 'raw deal' from local government. Much could be done to make life more convenient and to give the young a better chance of finding work and making a home in the community. Outsiders do not realise how{isloated}we are, and how much effort must be spent transporting the young and old. Her pub has{14th {Century foundations.}It is supposed to have a{ghost,}but she has not seen it. Tradition has it that it was a sailors pub in the days when Stourmouth was more or less an island.Oral tradition: Sailors were given a penny if they turned up for church on Sunday, they used to spend it in the pub. Before W.W.2 the building was thatched and the tenant spent most of his time looking for incendiaries on his roof.
